You'll never walk alone!

Machine Learning Notes (8)

September 14th, 2015

K-Means algorithm

Inputs :

  • K (number of clusters)
  • Training set

Cost function :

\[J = \frac{1}{m}\sum_{i=1}^{m}|x^{(i)}-\mu_{c^{(i)}}|^2 \]

We could repeat the following process for 50 - 1000 times and pick the clustering that gives the lowest cost.

  1. Ramdomly initialize K cluster centroids
    Randomly pick K training examples
    Set equal to these examples

  2. Repeat

    • Cluster assignment step
      for i=1:m
      = index of cluster centroid (1~K) closest to
    • Move centroid
      for k=1:K
      = mean of points assigned to cluster k
  • data science (11)
  • machine learning (9) ,
  • Coursera (9)
